subject: Psychology
title: Habits vs Goals vs Intentions
description: One-minute skill: Habits vs Goals vs Intentions.

hook.text: You intend to eat healthy. Your goal is to lose weight. But your habit is grabbing chips at 3pm. Habit wins.

buildup.text: Goals are outcomes you want. Intentions are plans to act. Habits are automatic behaviors that bypass both.

discovery.text: Research shows that when habits are strong, goals and intentions have little influence on actual behavior.

twist.text: This is why New Year's resolutions fail. Motivation fades but habits persist. Willpower can't override automation.

climax.text: The solution isn't stronger goals. It's building habits that automatically align with your goals.

punchline.text: Goals set direction. Habits do the walking.

quiz.question: Why do strong habits override goals and intentions?
options: Habits are automatic and bypass conscious decision-making
Goals are always stronger than habits
